intro: Mnesithea mollicoma, commonly known as the soft-stemmed mnesithea, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
